<figure data-orig-width="480" data-orig-height="92"><img data-orig-width="480" data-orig-height="92" src="https://40.media.tumblr.com/301cb0bc17ca76a396dc75e2651dee4d/tumblr_inline_nljg16UWsp1rr2wit_500.jpg"/></figure><figure data-orig-width="620" data-orig-height="160"><img data-orig-width="620" data-orig-height="160" src="https://41.media.tumblr.com/4e79dd538e2910a1151bf4e1f73a00c4/tumblr_inline_nljg1eidCL1rr2wit_500.png"/></figure><p>One of the most impressive collections of missions (if not <i>the</i> most impressive) comes from Mendahu. On his website he recreates real

world missions and pieces together an incredible overview of

spaceflight. <br/></p><p><br/>The collection currently spans 160 parts,

from the V-2 to the first Ariane 4 launch, and from NASA to the SSP. If

youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re interested in learning about humanityÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s history in spaceflight,

this is the place to start!</p><p>Check out the <a href="http://www.ksphistory.com/"><b>website</b></a>!<br/></p>

This is awesome. A must-read for... well... anyone, really.

11/10
Much like what Mulbin did but I must note it misses a lot of launches. But then again it is incredibily hard to keep focus in KSP.....Good work!
I'm learning as crap-ton reading though this, it's great!
I'm glad everyone enjoys this! Special thanks to Squad for bringing some traffic to the site. I post primarily through Reddit, so be sure to check out the discussions there!

Just mind blowing!

Can't possibly give you enough rep for your achievements...
Very awesome. I've found myself slowly looking through all of them (I'm at #36); thanks for making these.

This was really neat. His stock part replicas just gave me a bunch of design ideas!

Check out Bob Fitch's YouTube series Alexandria, he does historical launches also. With TONS of mods!

One of the few reasons I post in the subreddit.

Awesome as ever.
